etymology.description: Possibly depicts shoulders, tail of a fish, part of a chariot, pedestal, or small table
etymology.interpretation: The character 丙(bǐng) has multiple possible original depictions, but whichever it was, it has been primarily documented as one of the Heavenly Stems, used in calendrical and astrological systems. As its original representation is unclear, it demonstrates how pictograms can evolve to acquire abstract meanings.

examples.chinese: 在天干序列中(在天干序列中)，丙象征着火的热情(丙象徵著火的熱情)。
examples.pinyin: Zài tiān gān xù liè zhōng, bǐng xiàng zhēng zhe huǒ de rè qíng.
examples.english: In the heavenly stem sequence, 'Bǐng' symbolizes the passion of fire.

examples.chinese: 古人用丙火祭天(古人用丙火祭天)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén yòng bǐng huǒ jì tiān.
examples.english: Ancient people used 'Bǐng fire' to offer sacrifices to heaven.

examples.chinese: 在干支纪年中(在干支紀年中)，丙年带来夏季的温暖(丙年帶來夏季的溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gān zhī jì nián zhōng, bǐng nián dài lái xià jì de wēn nuǎn.
examples.english: In the sexagenary cycle, the Bǐng year brings the warmth of summer.
